column5: So, a buddy of mine has taken me to this place about twice now. I've caught on average (with my Ultra-Lights) 6inch bass, 4-5inch sunfish, the odd perch (5inches) and crappie (largest 9inches) all (at what I thought was the average) fish caught out of the lake, hence why I bought only my Ultra-Lights.  Buddy, rigs up with a WHOLE worm under a float. And I'm thinking... Nah, its not possible he can get some nice sized fish outta here. I mean, I know they stock once a year... but I don't think its possible. Anyway, to make a long story short - he does his lil dance, and gets tangled often enough to annoy the avg. fisherman... And what do I say to him.... "You know what that means?".. he replies "What?".... I say "Your gotta catch a big one, watch!".... Well, wouldn't you know it... there ARE SOME BIG BASS outta this little pond!  Enjoy the fish Pr0n!  1st Bass caught..(2 pics) [Pic 1 of 2]   [Pic 2 of 2]   2nd Bass caught... [Pic 1 of 2]   [Pic 2 of 2]     .... Here are my DINKIES!! Fish 1 of 2   ...My "Biggest" of the day!    We're hittin' up this place again on SUNDAY. This time, I'm coming PREPARED! ....."To be Continued...."....
ya should have kept your bait on rather then take a pic... have fun next trip and good on ya for the report.

Nice report man - looks like a quality day of bass fishing!  What kind of ultra-lite are you using?  Mine is a 5'6" St. Croix and those first couple bass would be a real riot on the UL.  Thanks for sharing - looks like a decent day at what I'm assuming is a relatively urban pond.  Ryan
Very nice! Pound that lake with top water lures in the evening!
Some decent fish. Bring the heavy gear now....
Mine is the 7'6" BPS model (2pc)... I think my buddies was Bill Dance 5'0"... pretty awesome that he caught 'em on UL's!!
nice couple of bucketmouths, a lot of the local ponds around the gta hold bass.
Nice ones A2F Congrats to the both of you's   :clapping: Leechman
the place looks familar but then again all the trees look alike
LOL @ Leechman!  At least someone was givin' me props!
